docs.title: Description
docs.text: Flight delays create problems in scheduling for airlines and airports, leading to passenger inconvenience and huge economic losses. As a result, there is growing interest in predicting flight delays to optimize operations and improve customer satisfaction. In this project, we will predict flight delays using the DOT flights and NOAA weather datasets from 2015 to 2021.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text: The Makefile contains the central entry points for common tasks related to this project.

docs.title: Syncing data to cloud storage
docs.text:
• make sync_data_up will use aws s3 sync to recursively sync files in data/ up to s3://mids-w261/data/.
  • make sync_data_down will use aws s3 sync to recursively sync files from s3://mids-w261/data/ to data/.

docs.title: Getting started
docs.text: This is where you describe how to get set up on a clean install, including the commands necessary to get the raw data (using the sync_data_from_s3 command, for example), and then how to make the cleaned, final data sets.

docs.title: Meet your flight crew
docs.text: Mohamed Bakr     Bakr led the data architecture and EDA, and developed the initial pipeline.    Erica Landreth     Erica focused on modeling and fine-tuning performance using advanced ML techniques.    Danielle Yoseloff     Danille contributed to visualization and final report formatting and storytelling.    Shruti Gupta     Shruti handled backend integration and orchestrated the final deployment.    Let the MEDS clear your runway!
